resources.string: Live Transcribe app icon will appear in your app list
Add app icon to app list?
Your device will vibrate when listed names are spoken
Add custom words or phrases that aren’t in the dictionary so that they can be transcribed
"Can't transcribe right now. Try again later."
"%1$s won't work unless you enable Google Play services."
"%1$s won't run without Google Play services, which are missing from your device."
%1$s is having trouble with Google Play services. Please try again.
"%1$s won't run without Google Play services, which are not supported by your device."
"%1$s won't run unless you update Google Play services."
"%1$s won't run without Google Play services, which are currently updating."
New version of Google Play services needed. It will update itself shortly.
May save data usage, but lose quality.
Google gratefully acknowledges the help of Gallaudet University
This sound will be permanently deleted
The status will be updated when processing is done
Your sound is almost ready. Continue to save your sound.
Record the sound for up to 20 seconds
The sound can’t be detected in the recording. Try again.
Sound Notifications will notify you when this sound is detected
"This sound hasn't been saved yet. To save it, go back and name this sound."

"You can add custom sounds of appliances beeping. Background noise may affect how well Sound Notifications detect your sounds.
Custom sounds aren't sent to or stored by Google, unless you choose to send feedback about sound quality."

"To add a sound, record an appliance beeping.
For better recording quality, find a quiet location to record your sound. Record the sound for up to 20 seconds."
This deletes saved transcriptions from your device
Sounds made by a clock that is designed to make an audible signal at a specific time.
The sound of a group of people clapping their hands to express approval.
A young child crying or bawling.
A wind instrument using enclosed reeds fed from a reservoir of air in the form of a bag.
A string instrument with a thin membrane stretched over a frame or cavity as a resonator, called the head.
Communication calls from birds including bird calls and songs.
Sounds produced by a cat, such as meowing and purring.
A larger, lower-pitched bowed string instrument with four strings.
A woodwind instrument consisting of a single-reed mouthpiece, a straight tube and a flared bell.
Art music produced or rooted in the traditions of Western music, including both liturgical and secular music, from roughly the 11th century to the present day.
A reflex consisting of an inhalation and forced exhalation of air often produced by obstructions in the throat.
A genre of United States popular music with origins in folk, blues and Western music, featuring instruments such as banjos, guitars and fiddles.
The sound of a large group of people gathered together.
"A distinctive 'cock-a-doodle-doo' sound made by a male chicken."
An Indigenous Australian wind instrument, usually cylindrical or conical.
Sounds produced by a dog, including barking and growling.
"The sound of a signalling device typically placed near a building's entrance with which a visitor can announce their presence to occupants."
A musical genre in which synthesisers and other electronic instruments are the primary sources of sound.
A loud noise-making device used to provide warnings to people nearby. A siren typically consists of a single pitch that changes either smoothly or abruptly.
A snapping sound caused by building tension between the thumb and another finger and releasing the other finger forcefully downwards to hit the palm at a high speed.
A reedless wind instrument that produces its sound from the flow of air across an opening.
A string instrument with strings running over a fretboard, typically played by strumming or plucking the strings with the right hand while fretting the strings with the fingers of the left hand.
Hip hop or rap music formed in the United States in the 1970s and consists of stylised rhythmic music that accompanies rhythmic and rhyming speech.
A music genre that originated from African-American communities of New Orleans during the late 19th and early 20th centuries.
A sharp noise of a rigid surface being struck, usually without damage and deliberately, most often with the knuckles of the hand.
Rhythmical contractions of the diaphragm in response to stimuli such as tickling, or from humorous stories or thoughts.
A mixture of sounds and silence with elements of pitch and rhythm often related to an art form or cultural activity.
Hindi film songs featured in Bollywood films. Bollywood songs are a characteristic motif of Hindi cinema.
Music originating from Latin America which encompasses a wide variety of styles, including son, rumba, salsa, merengue, tango, samba and bossa nova.
A genre of music intended to create artistic inspiration, relaxation and optimism as a method of stress management or to create a peaceful atmosphere.
A musical instrument played via a row of keys that the performer presses down or strikes with the fingers and thumbs of both hands.
A genre of popular music that originated in the West during the 1950s and 1960s. Songs are typically short- to medium-length with repeated choruses, melodic tunes and hooks.
The sound resulting from obstructed respiratory airways during breathing while sleeping.
A form of 1930s-1940s American music using a strong rhythm section with brass or string instruments and medium to fast tempos.
The sound of a physical or synthesised electric bell ringing to signal an incoming telephone call.
The sound of a toilet flushing water along with any waste through a drainpipe.
Sounds that originate from human-created machinery and devices.
"A high-pitched brass instrument played by blowing air through almost-closed lips, producing a 'buzzing' sound."
A small four-stringed guitar-like instrument that originated in Hawaii.
Sounds of mobile machines that transport people or cargo.
"The sound of a motor vehicle accessory whose purpose is to provide an audible alert of the vehicle's presence."
A wooden string instrument, typically with four strings, that is played by bowing or plucking the strings.
Music performed by one or more singers, with or without instrumental accompaniment.
Sounds caused by motion of liquid water, including streams, taps and rain.
Unvoiced speech, usually intended to be quieter to avoid causing disturbance or being overheard.
High-pitched tone produced by blowing or sucking air through a small opening between the lips. Used to draw attention or to reproduce a melody.
Sounds caused by the flow of air, usually in an outdoor setting. Strong wind can make transcribing speech more difficult.
Recording and inference beep detector disabled
Get notified when your appliances beep
See what happens when your device recognises the sound of a smoke alarm

"You've completed the demo.
You can update your notification preferences at any time."

"You'll get a notification when a smoke alarm has been detected.
Depending on your settings, your device may also vibrate or flash the camera light."

"You'll get a notification when a smoke alarm has been detected.
Depending on your settings, your device may also flash the camera light."
"You'll get a notification when a smoke alarm has been detected"

"You'll get a notification when a smoke alarm has been detected.
Depending on your settings, your device may also vibrate."

"Sound Notifications help you know what's happening in your home.
When Sound Notifications are on, your device will always be checking for sounds that you want to be notified about, like when a smoke alarm beeps or baby cries.
Audio and background conversations aren't sent to Google, unless you choose to send feedback about sound quality."
The sound of an automatic signal warning of danger.
The sound of a young child crying or bawling.
A short, single tone, generally made by a computer or other machine and typically high-pitched.

Any sounds coming from the familiar domesticated canid, which has been selectively bred over millennia for companionship, protection, as well as for superior sensory capabilities and other useful behaviours.
"The sound of a signalling device, typically placed near a building's entrance with which a visitor can announce their presence to the occupants."
A sharp noise of a rigid surface being struck, usually without damage and deliberately, most often with the knuckles of the hand.
Talk in a loud voice to deliberately command attention or overcome interfering sounds. Does not have the stronger emotional connotations of a yell or a scream.

The sound of a loud noise-making device used to provide warnings to people nearby. A siren typically consists of a single pitch that changes either smoothly or abruptly on timescales of around one second.
The sound of a physical or synthesised electric bell ringing to signal an incoming telephone call.
Sounds caused by motion of liquid water.
"At your request, Android is blocking this app's notifications from appearing on this device"
To receive notifications, you need to allow Sound Notifications to interrupt Do Not Disturb. You can update this in device settings.
Your device is set to Do Not Disturb
"When Sound Notifications are on, you won't be able to use 'Hey Google' or other phrases to start talking to any of your digital assistants"
"To use %1$s, the app needs access to this device's microphone and notifications. You can update this in device Settings."
Smoke alarms, fire alarms and more
Microwave beeping, water running and more
Choose when you want your device to vibrate or the camera light to flash
"Your device's camera light can flash when these sounds are detected"
Your device can vibrate when these sounds are detected
To use %1$s, the app needs access to notifications. You can update this in device Settings.
Baby sounds, dog barking and more
Notifications pause when your device restarts
Charge your device to keep using Sound Notifications
Another app is using the microphone. To resume, try closing other apps.
Notifications pause when the app updates
"Transcribe what's happening after a sound is detected"
Show icon in the app list
This helps us better understand sound detection accuracy
"Another app is using the microphone. To resume, try closing other apps."
Make sure that nothing blocks the device
Keep other sounds in your home low, like the TV
Centre your device in the room where you want audio detected
Sound Notifications are always on and may increase battery usage, so charge your device daily
Get notified about important sounds in your home, like when a smoke alarm beeps or a baby cries

"Audio and background conversations aren't sent to Google, unless you choose to send feedback about sound quality.
Bear in mind that Sound Notifications may not be able to detect all sounds."
"Your secondary language isn't available to download"
"Your primary language isn't available to download"
Get transcriptions without an Internet connection. This reduces mobile data usage.
"To transcribe offline, select a language that's available to download"

"Sound notifications update you about sounds in your home, like a smoke alarm or doorbell.
To open sound notifications, go to Settings at the bottom of your screen."
Filters unstable text for online transcription.
Tap %s on the bottom of the screen to start and stop transcribing.
Open Live Transcribe faster with the accessibility shortcut

"Live Transcribe captures speech from the phone’s microphone and displays it as text.
1. Turn on Live Transcribe. 2. Tap the Accessibility button on the bottom of your screen.
Google processes your conversations but never stores them."
"%s can't use the mic while the other app is using it"
"To use %1$s, the app needs access to this device's microphone. You can update this in device Settings."
This permission is needed to use Live Transcribe with Bluetooth devices. You can allow access at any time in device settings.
App is offline. Try connecting to Wi-Fi or switching networks.

"App is offline. You’ll see sound labels but not transcriptions.
Try connecting to Wi-Fi or switching networks."

"Transcript is too long to copy all text at once.
To copy the rest, find the text that isn't highlighted and select all again."

"You can start using Live Transcribe quickly with an accessibility shortcut.
Go to %s. Then turn on Live Transcribe."
To remove the Live Transcribe shortcut button, go to %s. Then, turn off Use service.
Transcriptions are saved for three days
Audio will help us understand transcription accuracy issues. The last 60 seconds of audio will be included.
Show icon in the app list
Pause transcription so that you can catch up on your reading
Segment transcript based on performance (rather than text length)
Includes sounds like laughter, applause and music
App is offline. Transcriptions and sound labels are still available.
App is offline. Transcriptions are still available.
With offline transcriptions, you can still transcribe without an Internet connection

"App is offline. Try connecting to Wi-Fi or switching networks.
Next time you're online, you can set up offline transcriptions."

"App is offline. Try connecting to Wi-Fi or switching networks.
You will still see sound labels. Next time you're online, you can set up offline transcriptions."
Download languages so that you can transcribe offline
Set up offline transcriptions in Settings
Different strategies to make displayed text more stable.
Swipe to see from where you left off

"Even with eyes protected by the green spectacles, Dorothy and her friends were at first dazzled by the brilliancy of the wonderful City. The streets were lined with beautiful houses all built of green marble, and studded everywhere with sparkling emeralds. They walked over a pavement of the same green marble, and where the blocks were joined together were rows of emeralds, set closely, and glittering in the brightness of the sun. The window panes were of green glass; even the sky above the City had a green tint, and the rays of the sun were green.
There were many people – men, women and children – walking about, and these were all dressed in green clothes and had greenish skins. They looked at Dorothy and her strangely assorted company with wondering eyes, and the children all ran away and hid behind their mothers when they saw the Lion; but no one spoke to them. Many shops stood in the street, and Dorothy saw that everything in them was green. Green candy and green popcorn were offered for sale, as well as green shoes, green hats and green clothes of all sorts. At one place a man was selling green lemonade, and when the children bought it Dorothy could see that they paid for it with green pennies.
There seemed to be no horses or animals of any kind – the men carried things around in little green carts, which they pushed before them. Everyone seemed happy and contented and prosperous."
Vibrate when speech resumes after pause
To get your attention when the speaker starts speaking again after a pause of at least 10 seconds, the phone vibrates
